name: phonically
content:

in a way that relates to the sounds made in speech, or to the study of these sounds: The English language is not phonically regular. The speech may be analyzed phonically.
in a way that uses phonics (= a method of teaching people to read, based on learning the sounds that letters represent): They compared the advances made by children taught phonically with those taught by the whole-word method. The students made reasonable progress when they were taught phonically. Related word
phonics
